metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4491 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The d_print_comp function in cp-demangle.c in libiberty allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and crash) via acrafted binary, which triggers infinite recursion and a buffer overflow,related to a node having "itself as ancestor more than once."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4491` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

valgrind - 1:3.11.0-1ubuntu4.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

gdb - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdb-multiarch - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdb-source - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdb64 - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
gdbserver - 7.11.1-0ubuntu1~16.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

binutils - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm1

binutils-multiarch - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnuspe - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm1
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.26.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.8+esm1

criterions.comment: valgrind package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.11.0-1ubuntu4.2').
ht package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
